org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.runtime

Class NiCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.runtime.NiCell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<NiCell>

    public class NiCell
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<NiCell>
    An immutable Cell wrapper which has identity and is not shared between reports or columns. The identity is added so that a NiCell adds personally-identifying information to a cell, for example the percentages (hiersTracker) or the upstream filters (passedFilters)

    • Method Detail

      • advanceHierarchy

        public NiCell advanceHierarchy(Cell newContents,
                               Cell splitCell,
                               java.util.Map<NiDimension.NiDimensionUsage,IdsAcceptor> acceptors)
        creates a new instance, obtained by advancing the hierarchy and passed filters of the given cell
        Parameters:
        newContents - the cell to embed in the new instance. Unless you are doing some voodoo, this would equal cell
        splitCell - the splitter cell used to advance hiersTracker
        acceptors - might be null, in which case passedFilters won't be advanced
        Returns:

      • mergeAcceptors

        public java.util.Map<NiDimension.NiDimensionUsage,java.util.List<IdsAcceptor>> mergeAcceptors(java.util.Map<NiDimension.NiDimensionUsage,IdsAcceptor> acceptors)
        computes a map of acceptors which is the result of merging this cell's passedFilters with the given acceptors. In case both the cell and the given acceptors contain a mapping for a given NiDimension.NiDimensionUsage, the given map has priority
        Parameters:
        acceptors -
        Returns:

      • getAmount

        public java.math.BigDecimal getAmount()
        computes, taking into account percentages, the amount stored in this cell. In case this NiCell is not holding a NumberedCell, the function will crash OR return a meaningless result
